channel.title: Make XP Look Like Vista!
channel.description:
[size=18pt]How to Make Windows XP Look Like Vista!!![/size]
[size=12pt]All free! All virus free![/size] [size=10pt]Make sure you have an Extracter such as Alzip or WinRar.[/size]
Changing Theme
Hehehe, in this little bit, I will teach you how to change the Windows XP theme into the Vista theme ;D.
First off, you will need to download a theme folder and dll. The one I use is -
http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/25958655/
View that page and click download. When it's finished, it will be in a .rar file. Now extract those files into C:\WINDOWS\Resources\Themes. Leave that rar aside now, we won't be using it anymore. You can delete it if you want.
Remember, this is all virus free - if you don't believe me, you can turn on all your anti virus scanners and firewalls if you want :). These themes are not made by me, and are not uploaded by me. If http://www.deviantart.com/ was full of viruses, it would have been shut down ages ago.
Now, we need to download a patcher for the dll that runs your themes. Since you can't use your new theme yet, you need to download this patcher.
Go to this link -
http://www.softpedia.com/get/System/OS-Enhancements/UXTheme-MultiPatcher.shtml
Click on the download button. Then download one of the 2 links in the next window. It shouldn't take long (only 1 mb). When you've finished, it will be in a .rar file. Open it and click on the exe. A new screen will pop up.
It will look like -
[img]http://i179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/patcher.jpg[/img]
It will ask if you have Windows Service Pack 2. Just Click "yes", it won't matter. Then when you finish patching, it will tell you to restart your computer. Restart it.
OR
If the patcher does not work for you -
Download this file -
[url=http://www3.telus.net/_/replacer/Replacer.zip]Replacer.zip[/url]
It will be in a zip file. Extract it to a folder, doesn't matter which.
There will be a batch file (or cmd) named replacer. Double click on it and a cmd window will appear (a cmd window is the same as the 'compiler' and 'runserver' window). It will ask you for your original uxtheme.dll. Find your uxtheme dll(Normally in C:\WINDOWS\System32) and drag it on the cmd window. Then it will ask for for a new uxtheme.dll to replace your original one with.
NOTE: PLEASE MAKE A BACKUP COPY OF YOUR ORIGINAL UXTHEME DLL IN CASE SOMETHING GOES WRONG.
Download this file -
[url=http://download.softpedia.com/dl/466f7d57c2993d6402d82d163a870ae3/468dd674/100002802/software/authoring/6.0.2900.2180_EN.zip]uxtheme.dll zip[/url]
Extract it to any folder. Then drag it in the cmd window after you've dragged your original one. It should replace your original dll. Restart your computer.
Then log into your user and right click on the desktop(not any icon, the background). Then click "properties"
[img]http://i179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/deskproperties.jpg[/img]
Then click the "appearance" tab and select the new theme in "windows and buttons".
[img]http://i179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/appearancetheme.jpg[/img]
Congratulations, you're done with themes!!! :D No joke, look at this! :cool:
[img]http://s179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/proof_of_vista.jpg[/img]
Here are some links to Vista-ish and non-Vista themes - http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/25906402/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/20664808/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/25272836/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/25005300/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/24533120/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/22445663/ http://www.deviantart.com/deviation/19519681/
You can check out -
http://www.wincustomize.com/ViewSkin.aspx?...ID=5347&LibID=1
This site includes themes, widgets, windows startup appearances, new icons, wallpapers, and more!!!
Move onto the next step if you want to make your computer even cooler :D
Changing Wallpapers
You can visit -
http://www.winmatrix.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=5254
For lots of Vista wallpapers!! It will make your computer look super cool ;D (Unless you want to keep your original background).
Or you can search on Google.
Changing Mouse Cursor
You can download the mouse cursor pack [url=http://bronch.com/downloads/risherz/aero-cursors.zip]here[/url].
Now the thing that you downloaded will be in a .rar file. You [b]must[/b] extract it. Extract it to a random folder, doesn't matter which.
Now in the folder that you extracted it to, there will be a little notepad-ish file called "install.inf". Double click on it and it should install automatically.
[img]http://s179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/cursors.jpg[/img]
Now after installing, go to Control Panel > Mouse. A new window will pop up. Click on "Pointers" tab. Congratulations, you can now use the mouse cursors from Vista!!!
[img]http://i179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/selectcursor.jpg[/img]
Changing Sidebar
For thse who don't know what a sidebar/widget is - this is an example of one -
[img]http://s179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/sidebar.jpg[/img]
To download a sidebar installer, go to this site -
http://www.thoosje.com/
It will make your XP look like Vista for sure ;D (Yes, Vista has a sidebar!)
There are many options you can choose from to appear in your sidebar -
[img]http://i179.photobucket.com/albums/w291/flyffhelp/sidebaroption.jpg[/img]
PowerToys/Tuning
You can choose many installers in the Microsoft website that will enhance your computer!!! (Some of these applications will make your computer have features like Vista).
Site -
http://www.microsoft.com/windowsxp/downloads/powertoys/xppowertoys.mspx
Congratulations on making your computer look like Vista! :D (Have fun showing off to your friends :P)
[s][size=12pt]Coming Soon![/size]
Vista Applications Vista Alt+Tab-ing like a slideshow. Vista Icons[/s]
(Not allowed ^ I s'pose?)
Cheers,
Microsoft®

item.title: Make XP Look Like Vista!
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I think I speak for quite some people when I say this. Windows Vista isn’t worth the hefty price tag, and the reason it’s so expensive is because the company that supplies it is a Capitalistic Pyramid, and a symbol of the degradation of corporate America. Whereas there are perfectly good open source OS’s like KDE, Ubuntu+Beryl, DSL, and even Mandriva (Not Open Source as far as I know, but a cheap alternative to Windows).

Why skin an already simple and easy to use OS, that really doesn’t look that bad. By adding these unnecessary add-ons you’re not only slowing the computer down, but you’re basically saying “I want Vista but I don’t want the price.” And when you say that, you’re saying you want a vulnerable, unreliable, piece of shit, that takes up too much room, and requires you to buy specific hardware/Software in order for it to operate efficiently.

Besides, this isn’t even a good Theme, you can get much better ones, with Aero, etc. I admit, I did use to have a Vista Skin, but that was before I got Linux, and that has forever changed my mindset on Operating Systems.

~ThAt0n36Uy

Read full topic
